confession.seduction_context: Anger because husband had beaten her, and at his mother's prompting who taunted her about it. Husband never said a kind word to her. Initially tempted while cutting bracken when she cut her finger and cursed by the devil, heard voice from oak tree saying 'Caigne je t'auray'. Later a man in black came begging without asking in name of God, she gave him a small coin (blanc) and he disappeared.
powder_types: substance from man on road from Pierrepont
sabbat_locations: place where carried by wind from searching for husband in tavern
sabbat_activities: drinking unpleasant liquid resembling urine from cup

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused to drink with her after George Pierson drank to Nicole, then she to the witness
testimony.threat_quote: bé Colas, je t'ayme bien, mais tu t'en repentira

testimony.quarrel_subject: Nicole's healing practices with animals; threat related to walking to Bruyeres; taking hay from meadow
testimony.threat_quote: que si elle marchoit a Bruyeres elle en feroit marcher des autres femmes et hommes

testimony.quarrel_subject: husband angry about pewter plate being changed when goods left as sureties

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: within a fortnight after buying replacement
next day after refusing soup on Assumption Day

testimony.quarrel_subject: husband wanted to acquire small piece of land from her to make passage for cart
testimony.threat_quote: que dieu ne luy feroit pas la grace de plus voir faire la chose (or 'la grace de l'avoir' in other version)

testimony.quarrel_subject: wife cutting bracken with Nicole, wife in hurry to get home and attend to house
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle n'auroit pas tousjours si bonne jambe

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: at same hour as quarrel about washing

testimony.quarrel_subject: cutting bracken, being in hurry; later dispute over washing 'une eschevette de filet noir'
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle n'auroit pas tousjours si bonne jambe; and about washing that she would repent

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: on way back from bracken cutting

testimony.threat_quote: Nicole had threatened her (according to other women)

witnesses.name: Claude Florentin
witnesses.occupation: musnier (miller) au moulin du Sr tabellion Harlachol

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over order at mill, wanted to go before Barbon belle fille of Nicolas Prosat

harms_alleged.target: Barbon belle fille of Nicolas Prosat

timeline.subject: Nicole Mercier
timeline.details: Taken at Docelles by George Milot, prévôt de Bruyères, at request of substitut for PG des Vosges

timeline.subject: Nicole Mercier
timeline.details: Additional witness testimony; Substitut asked for her arrest as she was thought to be selling property to collect money and flee. Prévôt agreed and ordered she be taken to château de Bruyères

timeline.subject: Nicole Mercier
timeline.details: PG des Vosges orders interrogation of accused

timeline.subject: Nicole Mercier
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; made some admissions

timeline.subject: Nicole Mercier
timeline.details: After hearing from doyen Demenge François that she was ready to confess, prévôt questioned her; confessed to devil pact, sabbat attendance, sexual relations with devil

timeline.subject: Nicole Mercier
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier confession with some hesitation; additional confessions about killing Nicolas de Sadeches, Messire Jean de Toul, and Nicole his tante

timeline.subject: Nicole Mercier
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for death sentence and torture

timeline.subject: Nicole Mercier
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence, but not the proposal for torture

timeline.subject: Nicole Mercier
timeline.details: Formal sentence from bons hommes jugeants

torture.restrictions: Request for torture was denied by Change de Nancy

accomplices_named.name: 5 or 6 people at sabbat
accomplices_named.context: Dancing back to back, masked so she could not recognize them, led by devil

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole Mercier
notable_quotes.french: bé Colas, je t'ayme bien, mais tu t'en repentira
notable_quotes.english: well Colas, I love you well, but you will repent of it
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Nicolas Melian after he refused to drink with her

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean George
notable_quotes.french: ayant laissé ce pauvre homme comme tout hors de soy et privé de son bon sang
notable_quotes.english: having left this poor man quite out of his mind and deprived of his good sense
notable_quotes.context: Describing Nicolas Melian's condition after Nicole's healing ceremony

notable_quotes.speaker: Jacotte veuve Thomas Laurent
notable_quotes.french: que si elle marchoit a Bruyeres elle en feroit marcher des autres femmes et hommes
notable_quotes.english: that if she walked to Bruyeres she would make other women and men walk

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole Mercier
notable_quotes.french: que quand le diable l'auroit emporté, elle en y iroit encor recueillir
notable_quotes.english: that even if the devil had carried it off, she would still go gather there
notable_quotes.context: Response when told off for taking hay from meadow

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole Mercier
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'avoit pas courru trois centz lieues de terre sans avoir apprins quelque chose, y adjoustant en touchant de l'une de ses mains en l'autre, qu'elle scavoit le moien de faire languir un homme un an, deux, et trois ans, et par apres que cela se pourroit faire avec des germons d'oignons
notable_quotes.english: that she had not run three hundred leagues of earth without having learned something, adding while touching one hand to the other, that she knew the means to make a man languish one year, two, and three years, and moreover that this could be done with onion sprouts
notable_quotes.context: Boasting about her healing/harming knowledge while treating horse

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Blot
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'auroit pas tousjours si bonne jambe
notable_quotes.english: that she would not always have such good legs
notable_quotes.context: Threat to his wife Jennon during bracken cutting

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Claudon Blot
notable_quotes.french: luy disoit de paroles emmillées bon jour te don dieu mon enfant et tu guery
notable_quotes.english: said to him in honeyed words good day god give you my child and you will be healed

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeon fils Mongeon Aubry
notable_quotes.french: que voyant uriner un homme, elle le pourroit faire seicher et devenir eticque, au moyen de lever de la terre sur laquelle auroit tombé son urine
notable_quotes.english: that seeing a man urinate, she could make him dry up and become consumptive, by means of taking up the earth on which his urine had fallen
notable_quotes.context: Overheard in house of George Pierson Mercier 4 years earlier

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole Mercier
notable_quotes.french: que s'il nous plaisoit, elle diroit, qu'elle est sorciere, et qu'elle avoit esté tentée par l'ennemy, mais que pourtant elle diroit mensonges
notable_quotes.english: that if it pleased us, she would say that she is a witch and that she had been tempted by the enemy, but that however she would be telling lies
notable_quotes.context: At end of confrontations when reproached for not objecting to witnesses

notable_quotes.speaker: Voice from oak tree
notable_quotes.context: Devil's first approach when she cursed after cutting her finger while cutting bracken

notable_quotes.speaker: Claude Florentin
notable_quotes.french: et qu'elle en empoisonneroit bien une de mesme que cela, de laquelle un homme enblessée ne seroit jamais guery, sinon par son moyen
notable_quotes.english: and that she could well poison one the same way, from which a wounded man would never be healed except by her means
notable_quotes.context: Overheard discussing poisoned blow her husband received

relationships.evidence_text: second marriage to George Pierson Mercier, native of Fontenoy-la-Joute, near Baccarat
First marriage had been to Philippe of Chaumont-en-Bassigny, for 10 years, by whom she had 2 children who died young
daughter of Jacques Jean Anthoine of Bain
sent his wife Chretienne to demand healing
Jacote veuve Aubert Jacot; Husband had been seriously ill for 2 years, and had died about 15 months earlier
Barbon belle fille of Nicolas Prosat
musnier au moulin du Sr tabellion Harlachol

economic_context.details: Goods left as sureties in Nicole's house led to dispute when pewter plate was changed. Dispute over land acquisition for cart passage. Accused thought to be selling property to collect money and flee before arrest.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Shoulder, face and body became extraordinarily hot as if burning; imprint of her hand on shoulder; cheek and other places came up in small red spots; became feeble and out of his mind; tore up stones and collected bagatelles; legs weak

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over pewter plate changed when goods left as sureties
harms_catalog.method_alleged: washing cloth in spring where horses drank

harms_catalog.harm_description: sickened, became too weak to get out of stable
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: within a fortnight after buying replacement
harms_catalog.method_alleged: washing cloth in spring where horses drank

harms_catalog.harm_description: felt she had 'un morceau a l'estomac'; slight deafness
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused soup Nicole offered on Assumption Day

harms_catalog.harm_description: seriously ill for 2 years, died about 15 months before testimony
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: wanted to acquire small piece of land from her to make passage for cart

harms_catalog.harm_description: legs hurt so badly could scarcely reach home; so ill for a month expected to die
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: cutting bracken, wife in hurry to get home

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell so ill they thought he was dying; strange sickness lasted a fortnight

harms_catalog.victim_name: late husband of Jacotte veuve Thomas Laurent
harms_catalog.method_alleged: should have sent to Bel Bernard for health

harms_catalog.harm_description: after drinking at spring, rubbed against fumier and fence, became ill in stable, trembling enormously

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Nicole had threatened her according to various women

harms_catalog.victim_name: small child in cot of Joseph Poirot
harms_catalog.harm_description: death of small child in cot

harms_catalog.victim_name: Barbon belle fille of Nicolas Prosat
harms_catalog.harm_description: knocked over by wheel of cart when horse took fright, breaking a leg
nearly killed when went under mill, losing consciousness for half an hour

harms_catalog.method_alleged: substance given to him; powder from man on road from Pierrepont
same substance from man on road

harms_catalog.victim_name: Messire Jean de Toul (formerly curé of Grantviller)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: always telling her off, especially after she sold 'Nicole sa tante une enfillure de cristal'
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder given by Persin, sent via woman from Rambervillers pretending it would cure infirmity

harms_catalog.victim_name: Nicole (tante of Messire Jean de Toul)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: pressing her to take back 'enfillure de cristal'
harms_catalog.method_alleged: peaches prepared by Persin to kill her

used for healing fevers, from 'jour de careme entrant', to be eaten on three mornings

used for healing horses mixed with pepper and wine
mixed with pepper and ginger for horse medicine

economic_hardship_indicators: concern about property being sold to collect money
religious_calendar_references: jour de careme entrant (start of Lent)

hearsay_chains.content: Nicole said if witness had sent to Bel Bernard for health of late husband he would not have died
Nicole might have given wife the illness
Nicole's words about husband not having grace to see cart passage

emotional_state_notes: went to hayloft and wept bitterly after temptation
angry at husband for staying long in tavern

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Nicolas Melian was a liar, a robber, and a beggar
Florentin Nesgate had been drunk like a beast at time he testified about

third_parties.name: George Pierson (husband of accused)
third_parties.context: Present when drinking incident occurred; frequently beat Nicole; at tavern when she went to sabbat

third_parties.name: Chretienne (wife of Nicolas Melian)
third_parties.context: Sent to demand healing from Nicole

third_parties.name: Sr Harlachel
third_parties.context: Met Nicolas Melian in street and advised him to threaten Nicole with burning unless she healed him

third_parties.name: Jean George
third_parties.context: Helped Nicolas Melian threaten Nicole; also testified as witness 6

third_parties.name: Demenge Jacquemin's wife
third_parties.context: Nicole suggested consulting her about 'la gisse'; assured Nicolas it was not that sickness

third_parties.name: le Bel Bernard
third_parties.context: Referenced as potential healer for late husband of Jacotte veuve Thomas Laurent

third_parties.name: Catherine (wife of Sr Harlachel)
third_parties.context: Told Nicole off for taking hay from their meadow

third_parties.name: Cathelon (servant of Sr Harlachel)
third_parties.context: Nicole gave thread to him to wash when Jennon refused

third_parties.name: Claudel (son of Claudon Blot, aged 9)
third_parties.context: Fell ill after mother refused to wash Nicole's thread

third_parties.name: Barbon belle fille of Nicolas Prosat
third_parties.context: At mill, prevented Nicole from going first; injured when horse took fright

third_parties.name: Nicolas de Sadeches
third_parties.context: Allegedly killed by Nicole 7 years earlier after refusing her apples

third_parties.name: Messire Jean de Toul (formerly curé of Grantviller)
third_parties.context: Allegedly killed by poison sent via woman from Rambervillers; had retired to St Dié

third_parties.name: Nicole (tante of Messire Jean de Toul)
third_parties.context: Allegedly killed with poisoned peaches; had purchased crystal string/beads from accused and pressed for return

third_parties.name: woman from Rambervillers
third_parties.context: Carried poison to Messire Jean de Toul on pretense of cure

third_parties.name: man on road from Pierrepont
third_parties.context: Threw substance at her feet that would kill those who took it

third_parties.name: small servant
third_parties.context: With Nicole when cutting bracken and devil first approached

third_parties.name: Persin (devil/master)
third_parties.context: Devil who gave her powder and prepared poisoned peaches

third_parties.name: Demenge François (doyen)
third_parties.context: Informed prévôt that Nicole was ready to confess

third_parties.name: mother of George Pierson Mercier
third_parties.context: Taunted Nicole about husband not wanting to marry her, contributing to her anger and temptation

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial features extensive witness testimony about healing practices that backfired, reputation evidence spanning up to 7 years, voluntary confession without torture (though torture was requested and denied), and multiple alleged murders confessed. Nicole's dual role as healer and accused witch is central. Case shows pattern of quarrels followed by harms, then healing by the accused. Outcome was death sentence approved by Change de Nancy without torture. Rich detail on material culture (food, healing substances, household items), social relationships, and economic disputes.
